com.edugility.maven

Class Artifacts

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.edugility.maven.Artifacts

    A utility class for working with Artifacts.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson

    • Method Detail

      • getLogger

        protected Logger getLogger()
        Returns a Logger suitable for this Artifacts class.

        This method never returns null.

        The default implementation returns the result of invoking Logger.getLogger(this.getClass().getName()).

        Returns:
        a non-null Logger

      • getArtifactsInTopologicalOrder

        public Collection<? extends Artifact> getArtifactsInTopologicalOrder(MavenProject project,
                                                                     DependencyGraphBuilder dependencyGraphBuilder,
                                                                     ArtifactFilter filter,
                                                                     ArtifactResolver resolver,
                                                                     ArtifactRepository localRepository)
                                                              throws DependencyGraphBuilderException,
                                                                     ArtifactResolutionException
        Returns an unmodifiable, non-null Collection of Artifacts, each element of which is a non-null Artifact that represents either the supplied MavenProject itself or a dependency of it.

        The returned Artifact Collection will be sorted in topological order, from an Artifact with no dependencies as the first element, to the Artifact representing the MavenProject itself as the last.

        All Artifacts that are not equal to the return value of project.getArtifact() will be resolved if they are not already resolved. No guarantee of resolution status is made of the project Artifact, which in normal—possibly all?—cases will be unresolved.

        Parameters:
        project - the MavenProject for which resolved Artifacts should be returned; must not be null
        dependencyGraphBuilder - the DependencyGraphBuilder instance that will calculate the dependency graph whose postorder traversal will yield the Artifacts to be resolved; must not be null
        filter - an ArtifactFilter used during dependency graph assembly; may be null
        resolver - an ArtifactResolver that will use the Maven 3.0.5 Artifact resolution algorithm to resolve Artifacts returned by the DependencyGraphBuilder.buildDependencyGraph(MavenProject, ArtifactFilter) method; must not be null
        localRepository - an ArtifactRepository representing the local Maven repository in effect; may be null
        Returns:
        a non-null, unmodifiable Collection of non-null Artifact instances
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if project, dependencyGraphBuilder or resolver is null
        ArtifactResolutionException - if there were problems resolving Artifact instances
        DependencyGraphBuilderException - if there were problems building the dependency graph
        See Also:
        ArtifactResolver.resolve(ArtifactResolutionRequest), DependencyGraphBuilder.buildDependencyGraph(MavenProject, ArtifactFilter)

      • handleArtifactResolutionError

        protected void handleArtifactResolutionError(ArtifactResolutionRequest request,
                                             ArtifactResolutionResult result)
                                      throws ArtifactResolutionException
        Handles an error that is represented by the supplied ArtifactResolutionResult that was issued in response to the supplied ArtifactResolutionRequest.

        This implementation performs the following operations:

        new new
 DefaultResolutionErrorHandler().throwErrors(request,
 result);
        Parameters:
        request - the ArtifactResolutionRequest that caused the error; must not be null
        result - the ArtifactResolutionResult that resulted; must not be null
        Throws:
        ArtifactResolutionException - if this method is not overridden to do something else
        See Also:
        DefaultResolutionErrorHandler, DefaultResolutionErrorHandler.throwErrors(ArtifactResolutionRequest, ArtifactResolutionResult)
